title: Wanting to learn Python, to build career.
author: t2_uy1lq
text:
Hey guys,

So I don't really know where to start, and I would really appreciate any help I could get.

Please suggest compilers, give me tips on what to focus on when starting, anything is super appreciated.

I do not have a degree or any major experience, besides some stuff I did in my free time in MySQL and a little bit of C++. 

I am currently unemployed and I would like to start my career in programming, but it's hard for me to get started, and I need a little kick in the butt.
I am very eager to learn, and learn fast. 


Thank you very much for your time.

comments.author: ZDRuX1
comments.body: Are you an IT guy already? You need years of experience with anything before any employer takes your seriously. You can't be proficient in anything in a few weeks or even months. Are you going to college for programming and just need tips with direction?

comments.body:
make lots of stuff in the sector you hope you enter, then realize you qualify for QA.

comments.author: Personal-Airport
comments.body:
Unrelated college?

Age?

Location?

Existing portfolio?

Soft skills?

Connections?

All of these variables matter - if you're 23 and have a degree in physics from UCB but just basic proficiency, then sure, a bootcamp should open some doors.
